intro: Phaeosphaerion leiocarpum, commonly known as the smooth-capped earthstar, is a unique member of the family Sarcospermataceae. It is a small, saprophytic plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in temperate regions. The plant is characterized by its distinctive earthstar-shaped fruiting body, which consists of a central stalk surrounded by radiating lobes. Its reproductive structures are adapted for spore dispersal, and it plays a role in decomposing organic matter in forest ecosystems. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is often rare and found in isolated locations.
